zyklone.LEDCloud.networking

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • zyklone.LEDCloud.networking.Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    The projects starting-class.
    This class instantiates an LEDCloud-object, and listens on an open tcp-port (6639 by default) for new connections. It reads a message from an accepted message and updates the LEDCloud's status according to the message's content.
    Author:
    Zyklone

    • Method Detail

      • start

        private void start()
        Loops endlessly, waiting for new json-messages to update the status of the LEDCloud.
        First the LEDCloud-Runnable is started in a new thread. Then an endless loop waits for new incoming connections and accepts them. The connected client has 5 seconds to send a message, before the connection is automatically terminated. If a message was received, a valid command is extracted if possible, and the LEDCloud's status is updated accordingly. The connection is then terminated.

      • closeConnection

        protected void closeConnection()
        Closes the Socket and its inputStream, if it is not closed already.

      • processCommand

        private void processCommand(java.lang.String message)
        Takes the incoming message, tries to convert it into a json-object and extract a valid command from it. If the contained information can be parsed successfully and is complete, the cloud's status is set accordingly.
        Parameters:
        message - the json-string to process

      • processAlarmCommand

        private void processAlarmCommand(org.json.simple.JSONObject json)
        Tries to extract a time out of the passed JSON-Object, parse it and set the clouds status to alarm-mode.
        Parameters:
        json - the json-object that should contain the alarm time

      • extractColorFromJSON

        private java.awt.Color extractColorFromJSON(org.json.simple.JSONObject json)
        Tries to extract a Color-object from a json-object.
        Parameters:
        json - the json-object the Color should be extracted from
        Returns:
        the extracted Color-object, or null if no Color-object could be created from the passed json-object

      • extractValidJSON

        private org.json.simple.JSONObject extractValidJSON(java.lang.String originalMessage)
        Tries to extract a valid json-message out of a String and convert it into a json-object.
        Parameters:
        originalMessage - the message that should be converted into a json-object.
        Returns:
        the extracted json-object, or null if the message does not contain a valid json-string

      • acceptConnection

        private void acceptConnection()
        Waits until there is a new incoming connect-request, accepts the connection and sets the classes inputStream accordingly. The read-timeout is set to 5 seconds. This is used as a threshold in which the client has to send a message, before the connection is terminated.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
